intro: Gireoudia stigmosa, commonly known as the Indian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural dispersal in the wild.
